page.title: 06RULLION GREEN FARM,Penicuik
page.content: Mr Smith, the farmer, works from 6am until 8pm and has one other man to help him with the lambing, shearing and dipping. There are{500 {acres of land}which is part of the Bush Estate Hill Farming Research Organisation. There are{530 breeding {ewes, 10 rams}and in 1985{624 lambs were born.{Hoggs}are last year's lambs and there are{130 of them.}There are{5 {sheep dogs.}Flash and Rex are semi-retired, Jim is working and Don and Ben are training. Each sheep gives 7 and a half kilograms of wool. There are also{30 beef cattle and a {bull. The name,{Rullion Green,}comes from the place where the{famous battle}took place between 900 covenanters and 3000 government troops on 28th November 1666.
